source.title: Development of the Hi-Skid Log Forwarder: A Short-Yarding, Self-Loading Truck
source.notes: Demonstration occurred November 1998 on BCIT Woodlot 007 (Maple Ridge, BC).

machine.configuration: Truck-mounted travelling fairlead + hydraulic winch + self-dumping log deck
machine.notes: Includes remote control, breakaway block, chain-based unloading system.

site.stand: 70-year CWHdm second-growth (Douglas-fir, western redcedar, western hemlock)
site.ground_conditions: Frequent obstacles (stumps, windthrow), uneven ground, thick moss

observations.notes: Includes yarding + loading at 4.16 m³/h; with 30 min travel/unload per 12 m³ load the system can deliver ~24 m³ per 8 h shift.

operational_tips: Use breakaway block to snake turns around obstacles and increase lift.
Anchor truck to adjacent tree until payload counterweights skyline forces.
Partially activate dumping chains during loading to realign slippery logs.
Tree-length logs should be bucked at roadside before loading to avoid deck fouling.
